intro: Warczewiczella lobata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf warczewiczella, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and compound leaves with finely divided lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to Central Asia and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
